text: The women's singles in the luge European championships was held in 5 January in Königssee. Germany's Natalie Geisenberger won the gold medal. Russia's Tatiana Ivanova finished second and Germany's Tatjana Hüfner won the bronze medal. ==Competition schedule== All times are (UTC+1). {| class=wikitable ! Date !! Time !! Event |- | 5 February || 14:20 || style=background:lemonchiffon|Run 1 |} ==Results== One run was used to determine the winner because the second run got delayed. {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center" |- bgcolor=efefef !Rank!!Bib!!Athlete!!Country!!Time!!Behind |- | | 23 |align=left| Natalie Geisenberger |align=left| Germany | 51.178 | — |- | | 12 |align=left| Tatiana Ivanova |align=left| Russia | 51.329 | +0.151 |- | | 24 |align=left| Tatjana Hüfner |align=left| Germany | 51.433 | +0.255 |- | 4 | 7 |align=left| Martina Kocher |align=left| Switzerland | 51.466 | +0.288 |- | 5 | 10 |align=left| Miriam Kastlunger |align=left| Austria | 51.587 | +0.409 |- |} Category:FIL European Luge Championships
title: 2017 FIL European Luge Championships – Women's singles
